Module lanat
Package lanat.utils.errors

Interface ErrorContainer<T extends ErrorLevelProvider>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of error level provider
All Known Implementing Classes:
ActionArgumentType, Argument, ArgumentParser, ArgumentType, BooleanArgumentType, ByteArgumentType, Command, CounterArgumentType, DoubleArgumentType, EnumArgumentType, ErrorContainerImpl, FileArgumentType, FloatArgumentType, FromParseableArgumentType, IntegerArgumentType, KeyValuesArgumentType, LongArgumentType, NumberArgumentType, NumberRangeArgumentType, OptListArgumentType, Parser, ParsingStateBase, ShortArgumentType, SimpleArgumentType, SingleValueListArgumentType, StdinArgumentType, StringArgumentType, Tokenizer, TryParseArgumentType, TupleArgumentType
public interface ErrorContainer<T extends ErrorLevelProvider>
Represents a container of errors. Methods are provided to get the errors under a certain level, and to check if there are errors under a certain level.

  • Method Details

    • addError

      void addError(@NotNull T error)
      Adds an error to the list of errors.
      Parameters:
      error - The error to add.

    • getErrorsUnderExitLevel

      @NotNull @NotNull List<@NotNull T> getErrorsUnderExitLevel()
      Returns a list of all the errors under the exit level defined in this error container. These are errors that would cause the program to exit.
      Returns:
      a list of all the errors under the exit level

    • getErrorsUnderDisplayLevel

      @NotNull @NotNull List<@NotNull T> getErrorsUnderDisplayLevel()
      Returns a list of all the errors under the display level defined in this error container. These are errors that would be displayed to the user.
      Returns:
      a list of all the errors under the display level

    • hasExitErrors

      boolean hasExitErrors()
      Returns true if there are errors under the exit level defined in this error container.
      Returns:
      true if there are exit errors

    • hasDisplayErrors

      boolean hasDisplayErrors()
      Returns true if there are errors under the display level defined in this error container.
      Returns:
      true if there are display errors

    • setMinimumExitErrorLevel

      void setMinimumExitErrorLevel(@NotNull @NotNull ErrorLevel level)
      The minimum error level that will cause the program to exit. All errors with a level equal to or higher than this will cause the program to exit. For example, if this is set to ErrorLevel.WARNING, then errors with a level of ErrorLevel.WARNING or ErrorLevel.ERROR will cause the program to exit.
      Parameters:
      level - The minimum error level that will cause the program to exit.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the minimum exit error level is higher than the minimum display error level.

    • getMinimumExitErrorLevel

      @NotNull @NotNull utils.ModifyRecord<@NotNull ErrorLevel> getMinimumExitErrorLevel()
      Returns the minimum level that errors should have in order to cause the program to exit.
      Returns:
      the minimum exit error level

    • setMinimumDisplayErrorLevel

      void setMinimumDisplayErrorLevel(@NotNull @NotNull ErrorLevel level)
      The minimum error level that will be displayed to the user. All errors with a level lower than this will be ignored. For example, If this is set to ErrorLevel.INFO, then errors including ErrorLevel.INFO, ErrorLevel.WARNING, and ErrorLevel.ERROR) will be displayed, but ErrorLevel.DEBUG will not.
      Parameters:
      level - The minimum error level that will be displayed to the user.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the minimum exit error level is higher than the minimum display error level.

    • getMinimumDisplayErrorLevel

      @NotNull @NotNull utils.ModifyRecord<@NotNull ErrorLevel> getMinimumDisplayErrorLevel()
      Returns the minimum level that errors should have in order to be displayed to the user.
      Returns:
      the minimum display error level
